website_summaries.verdict: The type of scalp shampoo brush to choose when you want a simple massage.
pros: Has a large surface area filled with long, pliable bristles to dig into the scalp in a gentle manner

Brush is contoured to fit your hand

customer_reviews.title: You owe it to your scalp
customer_reviews.text: I have baby fine, chest length hair that tangles in a light breeze. My scalp tends to get dry and flaky in the winter, so I figured this would be a nice spring cleaning for my scalp. How did I live without it?! It feels so good. My scalp isn't super sensitive so I give it a good firm rub with this brush, and it feels like heaven. I have ZERO tangles and a lot more bounce in my hair. My best advice if you want to avoid tangles is to not make big swirls with it. Small circles all over the scalp is super effective and feels like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shampoo seems to dry out my scalp and make the flaking worse, so I've started to use this INSTEAD of ...
customer_reviews.text: What sets this scalp brush apart from all the others on Amazon is that it's not hard rigid plastic. It's a little more forgiving on my scalp and doesn't hurt my hand to use. Shampoo seems to dry out my scalp and make the flaking worse, so I've started to use this INSTEAD of shampoo every shower. Since then I've noticed that my curly hair needs less conditioner to not be dry and frizzy.
customer_reviews.author: Chia Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Must use with gentle pressure!
customer_reviews.text: Works on dandruff well. I comb through dry hair before washing. Then GENTLY rub it all over scalp while shampoo is in hair. I've noticed hair is fuller and less falls out during rinsing. Sometimes if I have the time I comb it through hair while rinsing out conditioner too. The only bad thing is that if you push too hard it can really make the scalp sensitive for hours after use. It took me about 3-4 uses before I found just the right amount of pressure to use so my head didn't feel like it went through a meat grinder.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: Gets down in there but be careful....
customer_reviews.text: Does a really good job getting down and scrubbing your scalp without being damaging or abrasive as long as your hair is lubricated with shampoo. The only drawback I find is that with long hair you have to be careful not to tear your hair which I suppose comes with the territory. I use it only when shampooing but not rinsing because I feel like it pulls and tears at my longer hair when rinsing. With that said, it's good for shampooing and if you have shorter hair, probably OK for rinsing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Glendee

customer_reviews.title: Wash Day Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and forgot it during a move. Nearly 3 months later, I found it while unpacking a forgotten bag and used it. My scalp hasn't felt this clean since I went natural 5 years ago. It's a $6 hunk of rubber (vinyl) that may have just saved my wash days. I could never get my scalp as clean as I wanted with just my fingers and nails. I don't have to be ashamed of my scalp any more! I have bra strap-length, curly/coily hair, and I had no issue with it tangling in my hair.

customer_reviews.title: It's a rubber scalp brush and a darn good one.
customer_reviews.text: It's a brush, made of rubber, that you use in the shower to scrub your scalp. Pretty straight forward. It's flexible and conforms to the contours of my slightly misshapen skull. The 'nubbies' are firm but not sharp. It's not painful to really scrub and there's no real danger of scrubbing so hard you draw blood. I suppose you could draw blood, but that would take some extreme effort. You can flex the brush outward for easy cleaning. Giving your scalp a few passes with this brush leaves you feeling invigorated and possibly cleaner than those other unwashed heathens who don't own this product. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Helps with dry scalp

And it's done a tremendous job. I notice that my hair is bouncier and shinier. There's a lot less flaking as well. I think the shampoo you use will also impact your scalp health but I've seen a big difference with this brush.
